io.spine.tools.mc.java.validate

Class ValidateSpecs

  • java.lang.Object
    • io.spine.tools.mc.java.validate.ValidateSpecs

  • public final class ValidateSpecs
extends java.lang.Object
    A factory of message validation code.
    Implementation Requirements:
    The public generated API of a message validation is the validate() method declared in MessageWithConstraints.

    • Method Detail

      • validatorClass

        public com.squareup.javapoet.TypeSpec validatorClass()
        Generates the Validator class for the associated message type.

        The Validator class is supposed to be nested inside the message class. It is declared private and static.

        The name of the class is most often Validator. However, when a name clash occurs, the name is padded with the $ (dollar sign). For instance if the message itself is called Validator, the validator class will be called Validator$. Since the class is private, this naming is not exposed to the outer scope.

        The only method of the class is: 

         private static List<ConstraintViolation> validate(MyMsg msg) { ... }

        In this example, MyMsg is the type of the validated message.

        The class is marked with the Generated annotation so that static code analysis can ignore it.

        Returns:
        the validator class

      • validateMethod

        public com.squareup.javapoet.MethodSpec validateMethod()
        Generates the validate() method for the message class.

        The method is public and returns a list of ConstraintViolations if the message is not valid. For the full contract, see MessageWithConstraints.validate().

        Returns:
        validate() method

      • vBuildMethod

        public com.squareup.javapoet.MethodSpec vBuildMethod()
        Generates the vBuild() method for the message builder class.
        Returns:
        vBuild() method
        See Also:
        for the full contract.
